text: How many different 8 letter words are possible using the letters of the word SYLLABUS?
explanation:
SYLLABUS has 8 letters, 2S's and 2L's
\(\frac{8!}{2! 2!}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Let '*' and '^' be two binary operations such that a * b = a\(^2\)b and a ^ b = 2a + b. Find (-4 * 2) ^ (7 * -1).
Evaluate \(\int_0^1 4x - 6\sqrt[3] {x^2}dx\)
The population of a village decreased from 1,230 to 1,040 due to breakout of an epidemic. What is the percentage decrease in the population?
explanation:
Original population = 1,230New population = 1,040Decrease in population = 1,230 – 1,040 = 190Percentage decrease in population =decrease in populationx 100%original population
= \(\frac {190}{1,230}\) x 100 = 15.45%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The interior angle of a regular polygon is five times the size of its exterior angle. Identify the polygon.
explanation:
An interior angle of a regular polygon = \(\frac{(2n-4)\times 90}{n}\)An exterior angle of a regular polygon = \(\frac{360}{n}\)\(\frac{(2n-4)\times 90}{n}\) =5 \(\times\)  \(\frac{360}{n}\) (Given)= (2n-4) x 90 = 5 x 360= 180n - 360 = 1800= 180n = 1800 + 360= 180n = 2160= n = \(\frac{2160}{180}\) = 12The polygon has 12 sides which is dodecagon
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The area A of a circle is increasing at a constant rate of 1.5 cm\(^2s^{-1}\). Find, to 3 significant figures, the rate at which the radius r of the circle is increasing when the area of the circle is 2 cm\(^2\).
explanation:
Area of a circle (A) = \(\pi r^2\)Given\(\frac{dA}{dt} = 1.5cm^2s^{-1}\)\(\frac{dr}{dt}\) = ?A = 2cm\(^2\)Now2 = \(\pi r^2\)= r\(^2 = \frac {2}{\pi}\)r = \(\sqrt \frac {2}{\pi}\) cm = 0.798cm\(\frac {dr}{dt} = \frac {dA}{dt} \times \frac {dr}{dt}\)\(\frac {dA}{dr} = 2\pi r\) (differentiating A = \(\pi r^2)\)\(\frac {dr}{dA} = \frac {1}{2\pi r}\)\(\frac {dr}{dt} = 1.5 \times \frac {1}{2\times \pi \times 0.798} = 1.5 \times 0.199\)\(\frac {dr}{dt} = 0.299cms^{-1}\) (to 3 s.f)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Make x the subject of the formula: y = \(\frac {3x - 9c}{4x + 5d}\)
explanation:
y = \(\frac {3x - 9c}{4x + 5d}\)
\(\frac {y}{1} = \frac {3x - 9c}{4x + 5d}\)
= y(4x + 5d) = 3x - 9c
= 4xy + 5dy = 3x - 9c
= 4xy - 3x = -9c - 5dy
= (4y - 3)x = -9c - 5dy
= x = \(\frac {-9c - 5dy}{4y - 3}\)
x = \(\frac {-(9c + 5dy)}{4y - 3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Solve for x: 3(x – 1) ≤ 2 (x – 3)
explanation:
3(x – 1) ≤ 2 (x – 3)= 3x – 3 ≤ 2x – 6Add 3 to both sides= 3x – 3+ 3 ≤ 2x – 6+ 3= 3x ≤ 2x – 3Subtract 2x from both the sides= 3x – 2x ≤ 2x – 3 – 2x∴ x ≤ -3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The diagram above is a circle with centre C. P, Q and S are points on the circumference. PS and SR are tangents to the circle. ∠PSR = 36\(^o\). Find ∠PQR
explanation:
From ∆PSR|PS| = |SR| (If two tangents are drawn from an external point of the circle, then they are of equal lengths)∴ ∆PSR is isosceles∠PSR + ∠SRP + ∠SPR = 180\(^o\) (sum of angles in a triangle)Since |PS| = |SR|; ∠SRP = ∠SPR⇒ ∠PSR + ∠SRP + ∠SRP = 180\(^o\)∠PSR + 2∠SRP = 180\(^o\)36\(^o\) + 2∠SRP = 180\(^o\)2∠SRP = 180\(^o\) - 36\(^o\)2∠SRP = 144\(^o\)
∠SRP = \(\frac {144^o}{2} = 72^0\)
∠SRP = ∠PQR (angle formed by a tangent and chord is equal to the angle in the alternate segment)∴ ∠PQR = 72\(^0\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If a car runs at a constant speed and takes 4.5 hrs to run a distance of 225 km, what time will it take to run 150 km?
explanation:
Let T be the time taken and D is the distanceFor the case given in the problem, the distance covered is directly proportional to the time taken i.e D α T⇒ D = ST where S is the constant speedD = 225 km and T = 4.5 hrs∴ 225 = S x 4.5
S = \(\frac {225}{4.5}\) = 50km/hr
When D = 150km
D = ST
150 = 50 \(\times\) T
T = \(\frac {150}{50}\) = 3 hrs
So it will take 3 hrs
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(\frac {3 - \sqrt 3}{2 + \sqrt 3} = a + b\sqrt 3\), what are the values a and b?
explanation:
\(\frac {3 - \sqrt 3}{2 + \sqrt 3} = a + b\sqrt 3\)
Rationalize
= \(\frac {3 - \sqrt 3}{2 + \sqrt 3} \times \frac {2 - \sqrt 3}{2 - \sqrt 3}\)
= \(\frac {(3 - \sqrt 3)}{(2 + \sqrt 3)} \frac {(2 - \sqrt 3)}{(2 - \sqrt 3)}\)
= \(\frac {6 - 3 \sqrt 3 - 2 \sqrt 3 + (\sqrt 3)^2}{4 - 2 \sqrt 3 + 2 \sqrt 3 - (\sqrt 3)^2}\)
= \(\frac {6 - 5 \sqrt 3 + 3}{4 - 3}\)
= \(\frac {9 - 5 \sqrt 3}{1} = 9 - 5 \sqrt 3\)
= 9 + (-5) \(\sqrt 3\)
\(\therefore a = 9, b = - 5\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of t, if the distance between the points P(–3, –14) and Q(t, –5) is 9 units.
explanation:
Let the given points be:P(-3, -14) = (x\(_1\), y\(_1\))Q(t, -5) = (x\(_2\), y\(_2\))PQ = 9 units (given)Using the distance formula,
d = √ [ \((x_2 - x_1)^2 + (y_2 - y_1)^2\)]
PQ = √ [ \((t - (-3))^2 + (-5 + 14)^2\)]
\(\implies\)√[ \((t + 3)^2 + 81\)] = 9
Squaring on both sides,⇒ (t + 3)\(^2\) + 81 = 81⇒ (t + 3)\(^2\)  = 0⇒ t + 3 = 0∴ t = -3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: At simple interest, a man made a deposit of some money in the bank. The amount in his bank account after 10 years is three times the money deposited. If the interest rate stays the same, after how many years will the amount be five times the money deposited?
explanation:
Amount (A) = Principal (P) + Interest (I) i.e. A = P + I
1 = \(\frac {PTR}{100}\)
A = 3P; T = 10 years (Given)
Since A = P + I
\(\implies 3P = P + \frac {P\times 10 \times R}{100}\)
\(\implies 3P = P + \frac {10PR}{100}\)
\(\implies 3P = P + \frac {PR}{10}\)
\(\implies 3P - P = \frac {PR}{10}\)
\(\implies 2P = \frac {PR}{10}\)
\(\implies \frac {2P}{1} = \frac {PR}{10}\)
\(\implies\) PR = 20P
\(\therefore\) R = 20%
Since the rate stays the same
A = 5P; R = 20%;T =?; A  =P + I
\(\implies 5P = P + \frac {p \times T \times 20}{100}\)
\(\implies 5P - P = \frac {2PT}{10}\)
\(\implies 4P = \frac {2PT}{10}\)
\(\implies 2P = \frac {PT}{10}\)
\(\implies\) PT = 20P
\(\therefore\) T = 20 years
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Evaluate the following limit: \(lim_{x\to2} \frac {x^2 + 4x - 12}{x^2 - 2x}\)
explanation:
\(lim_{x\to2} \frac {x^2 + 4x - 12}{x^2 - 2x}\) = \(lim_{x\to2} \frac {(x - 2)(x + 6)}{x(x - 2)}\)
\(lim_{x\to2} \frac {x + 6}{x}\)
\(\frac {2 + 6}{2} = \frac {8}{2}\) = 4
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The ages of students in a small primary school were recorded in the table below.



 Age          
        5 - 6
             7 - 8
       9 -10


Frequency
          29

         38 




Estimate the mean
explanation:
Class IntervalClass MarkFrequency (f)fx5 - 65.5295.5 x 29 = 159.57 - 87.5407.5 x 40 = 3009 - 109.5389.5 x 38 = 361\(\sum f = 107\)\(\sum fx = 820.5\)
Mean = \(\frac{\sum fx}{\sum f} = \frac {820.5}{107}\) = 7.7 (1 d.p)

text: A committee of 5 people is to be chosen from a group of 6 men and 4 women. How many committees are possible if there is to be a majority of women?
explanation:
If the majority are women implies that:3 Women and 2 Men Or 4 Women and 1 Man
= \(^4C_3 \times^6C_2+^4C_4\times^6C_1\)
= \(4 \times 15 + 1 \times 6\)
= 60 + 6 = 66
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
If D = \(\begin{bmatrix}2& -1&3\\4&1&2\\1&-3&1\\\end{bmatrix}\)
Find |D|
A boat sails 8 km north from P to Q and then sails 6 km west from Q to R. Calculate the bearing of R from P. Give your answer to the nearest degree.
explanation:
tan θ = \(\frac {opp}{adj} = \frac {RQ}{QP} = \frac {6}{8}\)
tan θ = 0.75θ = tan\(^{-1} (0.75) = 36.87^o\)∴ The bearing of R from P = 360\(^o\) - 36.87\(^o\) = 323\(^o\) (to the nearest degree)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A coin is thrown 3 times. What is the probability that atleast one head is obtained?
explanation:
Sample space = {HHH, HHT, HTH, THH, TTH, THT, HTT, TTT}Total number of possible outcomes = 2 x 2 x 2 = 8favourable number of outcomes = 7
∴Pr(at least one head) = \(\frac {7}{8}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the equation of straight line passing through (2, 3) and perpendicular to the line \(3x + 2y + 4 = 0\)
explanation:
\(3x + 2y + 4 = 0\)
Rearrange:
\(2y = -3x - 4\)
Divide both sides by 2
y = \(\frac {-3 \times - 4}{2}\)
y = \(\frac {-3}{2} \times - 2\)
∴ the gradient of the line 3x + 2y + 4 = 0 is \(\frac {-3}{2}\)
If two lines are perpendicular to each other ∴ \(m_1 x m_2\) = -1
Let \(m_1 = \frac {-3}{2} \therefore m_2 = \frac {-1}{m_1} = \frac {-1}{-3/2} = \frac {2}{3}\)
From the equation of a line which is given as m = \(\frac {y - y_1}{x - x_1} where (x_1, y_1) = (2,3)\)
\(\therefore \frac {2}{3} = \frac {y - 3}{x - 2}\)
=3(y - 3) = 2(x - 2)
=3y - 9 = 2 x -4
=3y = 2 x -4 + 9
∴ 3y = 2x + 5
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Differentiate the function y = \(\sqrt[3]{x^2}(2x - x^2)\)
explanation:
y = \(\sqrt[3]{x^2(2x - x^2)} = x^{2/3} (2x - x^2)\)
= \(2x^{5/3} - x^{8/3}\)
Now, we can differentiate the function
\(\therefore \frac {dy}{dx} = \frac {10x^{2/3}}{3} - \frac {8x^{5/3}}{3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Calculate the mean deviation of the first five prime numbers.
explanation:
The first five prime numbers are 2, 3, 5, 7 and 11
M.D = \(\frac {\sum (x - x̄)}{n}\)
n = 5
\(x̄ = \frac {\sum x}{n} = \frac {2 + 3 + 5 + 7 + 11}{5} = \frac {28}{5} = 5.6\)
M.D = \(\frac {(2 - 5.6) + (3 - 5.6) + (5 - 5.6) + (7 - 5.6) + (11 - 5.6)}{5}\)
= \(\frac {(-3.6) + (-2.6) + (-0.6) + (1.4) + (5.4)}{5} = \frac {13.6}{5}\)
Take the absolute value of all numbers in bracket
= \(\frac {3.6 + 2.6 + 0.6 + 1.4 + 5.4}{5} = \frac {13.6}{5}\)
\(\therefore M.D = 2.72\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Determine the area of the region bounded by y = \(2x^2\) + 10 and Y = \(4x + 16\).
explanation:
To find the point of intersection, equate the two equations⇒ 2x\(^2\) + 10 = 4x + 16⇒ 2x\(^2\) + 10 - 4x - 16 = 0⇒ 2x\(^2\) - 4x - 6 = 0Factorize⇒ 2(x + 1)(x - 3) = 0∴ x = -1 or 3The curves will intersect at -1 and 3
Area = \(\int^b_a\) [upper function] - [lower function] dx
= \(\int^3_1 4x + 16 - (2x^2 + 10) dx\)
= \(\int^3_1 -2x^2 + 4x + 6dx\)
= \((\frac {-2x^3}{3} + 2x^2 + 6x)^3_1\)
= \((\frac {-2(3)^3}{3} + 2(3)^2 + 6(3)) - (\frac {-2(-1)^3}{3} + 2(-1)^2 + 6(-1))\)
= 18 - \((\frac {10}{3})\)
= 18 + \(\frac {10}{3}\)
= \(\frac {64}{3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of y if \(402_y = 102_{ten}\)
Find the value of y, if log (y + 8) + log (y - 8) = 2log 3 + 2log 5
In a group of 500 people, 350 people can speak English, and 400 people can speak French. Find how many people can speak both languages.
explanation:
Let F be the set of people who can speak French and E be the set of people who can speak English. Then,n(F) = 400n(E) = 350n(F ∪ E) = 500We have to find n(F ∩ E).Now, n(F ∪ E) = n(F) + n(E) – n(F ∩ E)⇒ 500 = 400 + 350 – n(F ∩ E)⇒ n(F ∩ E) = 750 – 500 = 250.∴ 250 people can speak both languages.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Factorize: \(16x^4 - y^4\)
explanation:
16\(x^4 - y^4\)= 2\(^4x^4 - y^4\)= \((2x)^4 - y^4\)= \(((2x)^2)^2 - (y^2)^2\)Using a\(^2 - b^2\) = (a - b)(a + b) identity= ((2x)\(^2 - y^2)((2x)^2 + y^2)\)Using the identity one more time= \((2x - y)(2x + y)((2x)^2 + y^2)\)∴ \((2x - y)(2x + y)(4x^2 + y^2)\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

A = { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}B = { 2, 4, 6, 8 }A - B = { 1, 3, 5 }B - A = { 8 }∴ (A - B) ⋃ (B - A) = {1, 3, 5, 8}
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A bag contains 8 red balls and some white balls. If the probability of drawing a white ball is half of the probability of drawing a red ball then find the probability of drawing a red ball and a white ball if the balls are drawn without replacement.
explanation:
Let the number of white balls be n
The number of red balls = 8
Now, the probability of drawing a white ball = \(\frac {n}{n + 8}\)
The probability of drawing a red ball = \(\frac {8}{n + 8}\)
Since Pr(White ball) = \(\frac{1}{2}\) x Pr(Red ball)
\(\therefore \frac {n}{n + 8} = \frac {1}{2}\times \frac {8}{n + 8}\)
= \(\frac {n}{n + 8} = \frac {4}{n + 8}\)
\(\therefore n = 4\)
Number of white balls = 4
The possible number of outcomes = n + 8 = 4 + 8 = 12
Pr(Red ball and White ball) = Pr(Red ball) x Pr(White ball)
Pr(Red ball) = \(\frac {8}{12}\)
Pr(Red ball) = \(\frac {4}{11}\)
Pr(Red ball and white ball) = \(\frac {8}{12} \times \frac {4}{11}\)
\(\therefore\)Pr(Red ball and white ball) = \(\frac {8}{33}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The ages of students in a small primary school were recorded in the table below.



Age
 5-6  
 7-8
 9-10


Frequency
  29
  40
   38




Estimate the median.
explanation:
\(\frac {N + 1}{2} = \frac {107 + 1}{2}\) th = 54th value i.e the median age is in the interval "7 - 8" (29 + 25 = 54)
Median = \(1_m + (\frac {^{\sum f} /_2 - f_b}{f_m})\)c
\(l_m\)=lower class boundary of the median age = 6.5
\(\sum f\) = 107
\(f_b\) = sum of all frequencies before the median age = 29
\(f_m\)=frequency of the median age = 40
c = class width = 8.5 - 6.5 = 2
Median = 6.5 + \((\frac {^{107}/_2 - 29}{40})\) x 2
= 6.5 + \((\frac {53.5 - 29}{40})\) x 2
= 6.5 + \((\frac {24.5}{40})\) x 2
= 6.5 + 1.225
\(\therefore\) median age = 7.725
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Find the matrix A
A \(\begin {bmatrix} 0 & 1\\2 & -1 \end {bmatrix}\) = \(\begin {bmatrix} 2 & -1\\1 & 0 \end {bmatrix}\)
explanation:
Let A = \(\begin {bmatrix} a & b\\ c & d \end {bmatrix}\)
i.e \(\begin{bmatrix} a & b\\c & d \end{bmatrix}\) \(\begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1\\2 & -1 \end{bmatrix}\) = \(\begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1\\1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\)
\(\implies \begin {bmatrix} a(0) + b(2) & a(1) + b(-1)\\ c(0) + d(2) & c(1) + d(-1)\end {bmatrix}\) = \(\begin {bmatrix} 2 & -1\\ 1 & 0 \end {bmatrix}\)
\(\implies \begin {bmatrix} 2b & a - b\\2d & c - d\end {bmatrix}\) = \(\begin {bmatrix} 2 & -1\\ 1 & 0 \end {bmatrix}\)
By comparing2b = 2a - b = -12d = 1 andc - d = 0∴ b = \(^2/_2\) = 1a - b = -1⇒ a - 1 = -1∴ a = 0∴ d = \(^1/_2\)⇒ c = d∴ c = \(^1/_2\)
∴The matrice A = \(\begin {bmatrix} 0 & 1\\^1/_2 & ^1/_2 \end {bmatrix}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: How many students scored at least 25%
explanation:
Number of students who scored atleast 25% = 5 + 3 + 8 = 16
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(-2x^3 + 6x^2 + 17x\) - 21 is divided by \((x + 1)\), then the remainder is
explanation:
Let \(p(x) = -2x^3 + 6x^2 + 17x - 21\)Using the remainder theoremLet \(x + 1 = 0\)∴ \(x = -1\)Since, \((x + 1)\) divides \(p(x)\), then, remainder will be p(-1)⇒ p(-1) = -2(-1)\(^3 + 6(-1)^2\) + 17(-1) - 21∴ p(-1) = -30
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Let a binary operation '*' be defined on a set A. The operation will be commutative if
explanation:
A binary operation '*' defined on a set A is said to be commutative only if a*b=b*a, ∀a, b∈A.If (a*b)*c=a*(b*c), then the operation is said to associative ∀ a, b∈ A.If (b ο c)*a=(b*a) ο (c*a), then the operation is said to be distributive ∀ a, b, c ∈ A.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Solve the following quadratic inequality: \(x^2 - x\) - 4 ≤ 2
explanation:
\(x^2 - x - 4 ≤ 2\)Subtract two from both sides to rewrite it in the quadratic standard form:= \(x^2 - x - 4 - 2 ≤ 2 - 2\)= \(x^2 - x - 6 ≤ 0\)Now set it = 0 and factor and solve like normal.= \(x^2 - x\) - 6=0= \((x - 3)(x + 2)\)=0\(x\) + 2 = 0 or \(x\) - 3 = 0\(x\) = -2 or \(x\) = 3So the two zeros are -2 and 3, and will mark the boundaries of our answer interval. To find out if the interval is between -2 and 3, or on either side, we simply take a test point between -2 and 3 (for instance, \(x\) = 0) and evaluate the original inequality.= \(x2 - x - 4 ≤ 2\)= \((0)^2 - (0) - 4 ≤ 2\)= \(0 - 0 - 4 ≤ 2\)\(−4 ≤ 2\)Since the above is a true statement, we know that the solution interval is between -2 and 3, the same region where we picked our test point. Since the original inequality was less than or equal, we include the endpoints.∴ \(-2 ≤ x ≤ 3.\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: What is the general term of the sequence 3, 8, 13, 18, ...?
explanation:
Given the sequence 3, 8, 13, 18, ... which is an arithmetic sequencea = 3d = T\(_2\) - T\(_1\) = 8 - 3 = 5The general term of an A.P is:T\(_n\) = a + (n - 1)d⇒ T\(_n\) = 3 + (n - 1)5= T\(_n\) = 3 + 5n - 5∴ T\(_n\) = 5n - 2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The locus of a point equidistant from two intersecting lines is

options.A: where the sum of the distances of two focal points is fixed
options.B: the collection of points that are equally distant from a fixed point and a line
options.C: the perpendicular bisector of the lines
options.D: pair of bisectors of the angles between the two lines

explanation:
The locus of a point equidistant from two intersecting lines is pair of bisectors of the angles between the two lines.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Two numbers are respectively 35% and 80% more than a third number. The ratio of the two numbers is
explanation:
Let the third number = \(x\)
Then the first number = 100% \(x + 35%x = 135\)%\(x = \frac {135x}{100} = 1.35x\) (Note: 100% \(x = x\))
The second number = 180% \(x = \frac {180x}{100} = 1.80x\)
∴ The ratio of the first number to the second number = \(1.35x : 1.80x = 3 : 4\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The angle of elevation and depression of the top and bottom of another building, measured from the top of a 24 m tall building, is 30° and 60°, respectively. Determine the second building's height.
explanation:
The height of the second building H = h + 24
tan θ = \(\frac {opp}{adj}\)
tan 30\(^o = \frac {h}{x}\)
\(\implies\frac{\sqrt 3}{3} = \frac {h}{x}\)
\(\implies x = \sqrt 3 = 3h\)
\(\implies x = \frac {3h}{\sqrt 3}\) ....(i)
tan 60\(^o = \frac {24}{x}\)
\(\implies\sqrt 3 = \frac {24}{x}\)
\(\implies x\sqrt 3 = 24\)
\(\implies x = \frac {24}{\sqrt 3}\) ....(ii)
Equate equation (i) and (ii)
\(\implies \frac {3h}{\sqrt 3} = \frac {24}{\sqrt 3}\)
\(\implies\) 3h = 24
\(\implies h = \frac {24}{3}\) = 8m
∴The height of the second building = 8 + 24 = 32m
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Calculate, correct to three significant figures, the length AB in the diagram above.
explanation:
\(\frac {\sin A}{a} = \frac {\sin B}{b} = \frac {\sin C}{c}\)
\(\implies \frac {\sin 82^0}{43.2} = \frac {\sin 56^0}{AB}\)
\(\implies AB \times \sin 82^0 = 43.2 \times \sin 56^0\)
\(\therefore AB = \frac {43.2 \times \sin 56^0}{\sin 82^0}\) = 36.2cm (to 3 s.f)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An article when sold for ₦230.00 makes a 15% profit. Find the profit or loss % if it was sold for ₦180.00
explanation:
First S.P = ₦230.00
% profit = 15%
% profit = \(\frac{S.P - C.P}{C.P}\) x 100%
⇒ 15% = \(\frac{230 - C.P}{C.P}\) x 100%
⇒ \(\frac{15}{100}= \frac{230 - C.P}{C.P}\)
⇒15C.P = 100 (230 - C.P)
⇒15C.P = 23000 - 100C.P
⇒15C.P + 100C.P = 23000
⇒115C.P = 23000
⇒ C.P = \(\frac{23000}{115}\) = ₦200.00
Second S.P = ₦180.00
Since C.P is greater than S.P, therefore it's a loss
% loss = \(\frac{C.P - S.P}{C.P}\) x 100%
⇒ \(\frac{200 - 180}{200}\) x 100%
⇒ \(\frac{20}{200}\) x 100%
⇒ \(\frac{1}{10}\) x 100% = 10%
∴ It's a loss of 10%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Calculate, correct to three significant figures, the length of the arc AB in the diagram above.
[Take \(\pi = ^{22}/_7\)]
explanation:
Consider ∆XOB and using Pythagoras theorem
13\(^2\) = 12\(^2\) + h\(^2\)
⇒ 169 = 144 + h\(^2\)
⇒ 169 - 144  =h\(^2\)
⇒ 25 = h\(^2\)
⇒ h = \(\sqrt25\) = 5cm
tan θ = \(\frac {opp}{adj}\)
⇒ tan θ = \(\frac{12}{5}\) = 2.4
⇒ θ = tan\(^{-1}\)(2.4)
⇒ θ = 67.38\(^0\)
∠AOB = 2θ = 2 x 67.38\(^o\) = 134.76\(^o\)
L = \(\frac{θ}{360^o} \times 2\pi r\)
⇒ L = \(\frac {134.76}{360} \times 2 \times \frac {22}{7} \times 13 = \frac {77082.72}{2520}\)
∴ L = 30.6cm (to 3 s.f)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A rectangular plot of land has sides with lengths of 38 m and 52 m corrected to the nearest m. Find the range of the possible values of the area of the rectangle
explanation:
The sides have been given to the nearest meter, so51.5 m ≤ length < 52.537.5 m ≤ width < 38.5Minimum area = 37.5 x 51.5 = 1931.25 m\(^2\)Maximum area = 38.5 x 52.5 = 2021.25 m\(^2\)∴ The range of the area = 1931.25 m\(^2\) ≤ A < 2021.25 m\(^2\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A man sells different brands of an items. \(^1/_9\) of the items he has in his shop are from Brand A, \(^5/_8\) of the remainder are from Brand B and the rest are from Brand C. If the total number of Brand C items in the man's shop is 81, how many more Brand B items than Brand C does the shop has?
explanation:
Let the total number of items in the man's shop = \(y\)
Number of Brand A's items in the man's shop = \(\frac {1}{9} y\)
Remaining items = 1 - \(\frac {1}{9} y = \frac {8}{9} y\)
Number of Brand B's items in The man's shop = \(\frac{5}{8} of \frac{8}{9}y = \frac{5}{9}y\)
Total of Brand A and Brand B's items = \(\frac{1}{9}y + \frac{5}{9}y = \frac{2}{3}y\)
Number of Brand C's items in the man's shop = 1 - \(\frac{2}{3}y = \frac{1}{3}y\)
\(\implies\frac{1}{3}y\) = 81 (Given)
\(\implies y\) = 81 x 3 = 243
∴ The total number of items in the man's shop = 243
∴ Number of Brand B's items in the man's shop = \(\frac{5}{9}\) x 243 = 135
∴ The number of more Brand B items than Brand C = 135 - 81 =54
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the area, to the nearest cm\(^2\), of the triangle whose sides are in the ratio 2 : 3 : 4 and whose perimeter is 180 cm.
explanation:
Let the length of the sides of triangle be 2x, 3x and 4x.
Perimeter of triangle = 180cm
⇒ \(2x +3x + 4x = 180\)
⇒ \(9x = 180\)
⇒ \(x = \frac{180}{9}\) = 20cm
Then the sides of the triangle are:
\(2x = 2\times20 = 40cm; 3x = 3\times20\) = 60cm and \(4x\) = 4\(\times20 \)= 80cm
Using Heron's formula
Area of triangle = \(\sqrt s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)\)
Where s = \(\frac{a + b + c}{2}\)
Let a = 40cm, b = 60cm, c = 80cm and s = \(\frac{40 + 60 + 80}{2} = \frac{180}{2}\) = 90cm
⇒ A = \(\sqrt90 (90 - 40) (90 - 60) (90 - 80) = \sqrt90 \times 50 \times 30 \times 10 = \sqrt1350000\)
∴ A =1162cm\(^2\) (to the nearest cm\(^2)\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the compound interest (CI) on ₦15,700 for 2 years at 8% per annum compounded annually.

Find the volume of the cylinder above
[Take \(\pi= ^{22}/_7\)]
explanation:
Volume of the cylinder = \(\frac{θ}{360} \times \pi r^2h\)
θ = 360\(^o\) - 90\(^o\) = 270\(^o\)
∴ Volume of the cylinder = \(\frac{270}{360} \times \frac{22}{7} \times \frac{14^2}{1} \times \frac{32}{1} = \frac{37,255,680}{2520} = 14,784cm^3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The third term of an A.P is 6 and the fifth term is 12. Find the sum of its first twelve terms

The graph above depicts the performance ratings of two sports teams A and B in five different seasons
In the last five seasons, what was the difference in the average performance ratings between Team B and Team A?
explanation:
Average performance rating of Team B = \(\frac{7+9+1+9+6}{5} = \frac{32}{5}\) = 6.4
Average performance rating of Team A = \(\frac{5+3+6+10+2}{5} = \frac{26}{5}\) = 5.2
∴ The difference in the average performance ratings between Team B and Team A = 6.4 - 5.2 = 1.2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A student is using a graduated cylinder to measure the volume of water and reports a reading of 18 mL. The teacher reports the value as 18.4 mL. What is the student's percent error?
explanation:
% error = \(\frac{Error}{Actual Value}\) x 100%
Student's Value = 18mL
Actual Value = 18.4mL
Error = 18.4 - 18 = 0.4
∴ % error = \(\frac{0.4}{18.4}\) x 100% = 2.17%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The difference between an exterior angle of (n - 1) sided regular polygon and an exterior angle of (n + 2) sided regular polygon is 6\(^o\), then the value of "n" is
explanation:
An exterior angle of a n-sided regular polygon = \(\frac{360}{n}\)
For (n - 1) sided regular polygon = \(\frac{360}{n - 1}\)
For (n + 2) sided regular polygon = \(\frac{360}{n + 1}\)
⇒ \(\frac{360}{n - 1} - \frac{360}{n + 2}\) = 6 9Given)
⇒ \(\frac{360(n + 2) - 360(n - 1)}{(n - 1)(n + 2)}\)
⇒ \(\frac{360n + 720 - 360n + 360}{(n - 1)(n + 2)}\)
⇒ \(\frac{1080}{(n - 1)(n + 2)} = \frac{6}{1}\)
⇒ 1080 = 6 (n - 1)(n + 2)
⇒ 180 = (n - 1)(n + 2)
⇒ 180 = n\(^2\)+ 2n - n - 2
⇒ 180 = n\(^2\) + n - 2
⇒ n\(^2\)b+ n - 2 - 180 = 0
⇒ n\(^2\) + n - 182 = 0
⇒ n\(^2\) + 14n - 13n - 182 = 0
⇒ n (n + 14) - 13 (n + 14) = 0
⇒ (n - 13) (n + 14) = 0
⇒ n - 13 = 0 or n + 14 = 0
⇒ n = 13 or n = -14
∴ n = 13 (We can't have a negative number of side)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Two dice are tossed. What is the probability that the total score is a prime number.
explanation:
Total possible outcome = 6 x 6 = 36Required outcome = 15
∴ Pr(E) = \(\frac{15}{36} = \frac{5}{12}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the volume of the composite solid above.
explanation:
Volume of the composite solid = Volume of A + Volume of BVolume of a cuboid = length x breadth x heightVolume of A = 6 x 26 x 8 = 1248 cm\(^3\)Volume of B = 6 x 10 x 22 = 1320 cm\(^3\)∴ Volume of the composite solid = 1248 + 1320 = 2568 cm\(^3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the area and perimeter of a square whose length of diagonals is 20\(\sqrt2\) cm.
explanation:
Using Pythagoras theorem⇒ \((20\sqrt2)2 = x^2 + x^2\)⇒ 800 = \(2x^2\)⇒ 400 = \(x^2\)⇒ x = \(\sqrt400\) = 20 cm∴ Area of a square = \(x^2 = 20^2 = 400 cm^2\)∴ Perimeter of a square = 4x = 4 x 20 = 80 cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Bello buys an old bicycle for ₦9,200.00 and spends ₦1,500.00 on its repairs. If he sells the bicycle for ₦13,400.00, his gain percent is
explanation:
Total cost price = ₦9,200.00 + ₦1,500.00 = ₦10,700.00Selling price = ₦13,400.00Gain = ₦13,400.00 - ₦10,700.00 = ₦2,700.00
∴ % gain = \(\frac{₦2,700.00}{₦10,700.00}\times\) 100% = 25.23%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Evaluate \(\frac{5}{8} - \frac{3}{4} ÷ \frac{5}{12} \times \frac{1}{4}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{5}{8} - \frac{3}{4} ÷ \frac{5}{12} x \frac{1}{4}\)
⇒ \(\frac{5}{8} - (\frac{3}{4} ÷ \frac{5}{12}) \times \frac{1}{4}\)
⇒ \(\frac{5}{8} - (\frac{3}{4} \times \frac{12}{5}) \times \frac{1}{4}\)
⇒ \(\frac{5}{8} - (\frac{9}{5} \times \frac{1}{4})\)
⇒ \(\frac{5}{8} - \frac{9}{20}\)
∴ \(\frac{7}{40}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A rectangle has one side that is 6 cm shorter than the other. The area of the rectangle will increase by 68 cm\(^2\) if we add 2 cm to each side of the rectangle. Find the length of the shorter side.
explanation:
Let the length of the longer side = \(x\) cm∴ The length of the shorter side = (\(x\) - 6) cmIf we increase each side's length by 2 cm, it becomes(\(x\) + 2) cm and (\(x\) - 4) cm respectivelyArea of a rectangle = L x B\(A_1 = x(x - 6) = x^2 - 6x\)\(A_2 = (x + 2)(x - 4) = x^2 - 4x + 2x - 8 = x^2 - 2x - 8\)\(A_1 + 68 = A_2\) (Given)⇒ \(x^2 - 6x + 68 = x^2 - 2x - 8\)⇒ \(x^2 - x^2 - 6x + 2x\) = -8 - 68⇒ -4\(x\) = -76
⇒ \(x\) = \(\frac{-76}{-4}\) = 19cm
∴ The length of the shorter side = \(x\) - 6 = 19 - 6 = 13 cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The second term of a geometric series is \(^{-2}/_3\) and its sum to infinity is \(^3/_2\). Find its common ratio.
explanation:
\(T_2 = \frac{-2}{3};S_\infty \frac {3}{2}\)
\(T_n = ar^n - 1\)
∴ \(T_2 = ar = \frac{-2}{3}\)---eqn.(i)
\(S_\infty = \frac{a}{1 - r} = \frac{3}{2}\)---eqn.(ii)
= 2a = 3(1 - r)
= 2a = 3 - 3r
∴ a = \(\frac{3 - 3r}{2}\)
Substitute \(\frac{3 - 3r}{2}\) for a in eqn.(i)
= \(\frac{3 - 3r}{2} \times r = \frac{-2}{3}\)
= \(\frac{3r - 3r^2}{2} = \frac{-2}{3}\)
= 3(3r - 3r\(^2\)) = -4
= 9r - 9r\(^2\) = -4= 9r\(^2\) - 9r - 4 = 0= 9r\(^2\) - 12r + 3r - 4 = 0= 3r(3r - 4) + 1(3r - 4) = 0= (3r - 4)(3r + 1) = 0
∴ r = \(\frac{4}{3} or - \frac{1}{3}\)
For a geometric series to go to infinity, the absolute value of its common ratio must be less than 1 i.e. |r| < 1.
∴ r = -\(^1/_3\) (since |-\(^1/_3\)| < 1)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of the angle marked x in the diagram above
explanation:
\(PR^2 = PQ^2 + RQ^2 - 2(PQ)(RQ)cos Q\)
\(\implies cos Q = \frac{PQ^2 + RQ^2 - PR^2}{2(PQ)(RQ)}\)
\(\implies cos Q = \frac{8^2 + 5^2 - 7^2}{2\times8\times5}\)
\(\implies cos Q = \frac{64 + 25 - 49}{80}\)
\(\implies cos Q = \frac{40}{80} = 0.5\)
\(\implies Q = cos^{-1} (0.5) = 60^0\)
\(\therefore x = 60^0\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The line \(3y + 6x\) = 48 passes through the points A(-2, k) and B(4, 8). Find the value of k.
explanation:
The line: \(3y + 6x\) = 48
Divide through by 3
⇒ y + 2\(x\) = 16
⇒ y = -2\(x\) + 16
∴ The gradient of the line = -2
The points: A(-2, k) and B (4, 8)
m =\(\frac{y2 - y1}{x2 - x1} = \frac{8 - k}{4 - (-2)}\)
⇒ m =\(\frac[8 - k}{4 + 2} = {8 - k}{6}\)
Since the line passes through the points
∴ -2 = \(\frac{8 - k}{6}\)
⇒ \(\frac{-2}[1} = \frac{8 - k]{6}\)
⇒ 8 - k = -12
⇒ k = 8 + 12
∴ k = 20
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Tickets for the school play were priced at ₦520.00 each for adults and ₦250.00 each for kids. How many kids' tickets were sold if the total sales were ₦171,000.00 and there were 5 times as many adult tickets sold as children's tickets?
explanation:
Let number of children's ticket at ₦250.00 each = \(x\)∴ Number of adult tickets at ₦520.00 each = 5\(x\)Then,Total amount of money received from children's tickets = 250\(x\)Total amount of money received from adult tickets = 520(5\(x\))⇒ 250\(x\) + 520(5\(x\)) = 171,000⇒ 250\(x\) + 2600\(x\) = 171,000⇒ 2850\(x\) = 171,000
⇒ \(x = \frac{171,000}{2850} = 60\)∴ 60 tickets were sold at ₦250.00 and 300 tickets were sold at ₦520.00
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Solve the logarithmic equation: \(log_2 (6 - x) = 3 - log_2 x\)
Calculate the area of the composite figure above.
explanation:
Area of the composite figure = Area of semi circle + Area of rectangle + Area of triangle
Area of semi circle = \(\frac{1}{2}\pi r^2 = \frac{1}{2}\times\pi\times\frac{d^2}{4} = \frac{1}{2}\times\frac{22}{7}\times\frac{42^2}{4} = 693 m^2\)
Area of rectangle = l x b = 42 x 60  =2520 m\(^2\)
Area of triangle = \(\frac{1}{2}\times b \times h = \frac{1}{2}\times 36 \times 42 = 756 m^2\)
∴ Area of the composite figure = 693 + 2520 + 756 = 3969 m\(^2\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the value of x in the diagram above
explanation:
Intersecting Chords Theorem states that If two chords intersect in a circle, then the products of the measures of the segments of the chords are equal.⇒ AE * EB = CE * ED⇒ 6 * \(x\) = 4 * (\(x\) + 5)⇒ 6\(x\) = 4\(x\) + 20⇒ 6\(x\) - 4\(x\) = 20⇒ 2\(x\) = 20
∴ \(x = \frac{20}{2}\) = 10 units
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which inequality describes the graph above?
explanation:
First, we find the equation of the boundary line using the two intercepts.The slope is
m = \(\frac{4 - 0}{0 - 5} = {4}{5}\)
The y-intercept is 4
The slope-intercept form of the equation is therefore
y = -\(\frac{4}{5} x + 4\)
\(\implies y + \frac{4}{5} x = 4\)
Multiply both sides by \(\frac{5}{4}\)
\(\implies\frac{5}{4}(y +\frac{4}{5} x) = 4\times\frac{5}{4}\)
\(\implies\frac{5}{4} y + x = 5\)
Multiply both sides by 4
⇒ \(5y + 4x = 20\)
The inequality is therefore either \(5y + 4x ≤ 20\) or \(5y + 4x ≥ 20.\)
Using the test point (0, 0) -The origin
⇒ 5(0) + 4(0) ≤ 20
⇒ 0 ≤ 20 (True)
∴ The inequality is \(5y + 4x ≤ 20\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the volume of a cone which has a base radius of 5 cm and slant height of 13 cm.
explanation:
Volume of a cone = \(\frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h\)r = 5 cml = 13 cmUsing Pythagoras theorem⇒ \(13^2 = 5^2 + h^2\)⇒ \(169 = 25 + h^2\)⇒ \(169 - 25 = h^2\)⇒ \(h^2 = 144\)⇒ \(h = \sqrt144 = 12 cm\)
∴ Volume of the cone = \(\frac{1}{3} \times\pi\times 5^2 x 12 = 100\pi\) cm\(^3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Study the given histogram above and answer the question that follows.
What is the total number of students that scored at most 50 marks?
explanation:
Total number of students that scored at most 50 marks = 100 + 80 + 60 + 40 + 80 = 360
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The area of a trapezium is 200 cm\(^2\). Its parallel sides are in the ratio 2 : 3 and the perpendicular distance between them is 16 cm. Find the length of each of the parallel sides.
explanation:
Area of trapezium = \(\frac{1}{2}(a + b) h\)
⇒ \(\frac{1}{2} (a + b)\times 16 = 200\)
⇒ 8(a + b) = 200
⇒ a + b = \(\frac{200}{8}\) = 25 -----(i)
⇒ a : b = 2 : 3
⇒ \(\frac{a}{b} = \frac{2}{3}\)
⇒ 3a = 2b
⇒ a = \(\frac{2b}{3}\) -------(ii)
Substitute \(\frac{2b}{3}\) for a in equation (i)
⇒ \(\frac{2b}{3}\) + b = 25
\(\frac{5b}{3}\) = 25
⇒ b = 25 ÷ \(\frac{5}{3} = 25\times\frac{3}{5} = 15cm\)
From equation (ii)
⇒ a = \(\frac{2 \times 15}{3} = 2\times5 = 10cm\)
∴ Lengths of each parallel sides are 10cm and 15cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: PQRS is a cyclic quadrilateral. Find \(x\) + \(y\)

A student pilot was required to fly to an airport and then return as part of his flight training. The average speed to the airport was 120 km/h, and the average speed returning was 150 km/h. If the total flight time was 3 hours, calculate the distance between the two airports.
explanation:
Speed = \(\frac{Distance}{Time}\)
⇒ Time = \(\frac{Distance}{Time}\)
Let D = distance between the two airports
∴ Time taken to get to the airport = \(\frac{D}{120}\) and Time taken to return =\( \frac{D}{150}\)
Since total time of flight= 3hours,
⇒ \(\frac{D}{120} + \frac{D}{150}\) = 3
⇒ \(\frac{15D + 12D}{1800}\) = 3
⇒ \(\frac{27D}{1800}\) = 3
⇒ \(\frac{3D}{200} = \frac{3}{1}\)
⇒ 3D = 200 x 3
∴ D =\(\frac{ 200\times3}{3}\)= 200km
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The perimeter of an isosceles right-angled triangle is 2 meters. Find the length of its longer side.
explanation:
Perimeter of a triangle = sum of all sides
⇒ \(P = y + x + x = 2\)
⇒ \(y + 2x = 2\)
⇒ \(y= 2 - 2x\)-----(i)
Using Pythagoras theorem
\(y^2 = x^2 + x^2\)
⇒ \(y^2 = 2x^2\)
⇒ \(y = \sqrt2x^2\)
⇒ \(y = x\sqrt2\)-----(ii)
Equate \(y\)
⇒ \(2 - 2x = x\sqrt2\)
Square both sides
⇒ \((2 -2x) ^2 = (x\sqrt2)^2\)
⇒ \(4 - 8x + 4x^2 = 2x^2\)
⇒ \(4 - 8x + 4x^2 - 2x^2 = 0\)
⇒ \(2x^2 - 8x + 4 = 0\)
⇒ \(x = \frac{-(-8)\pm\sqrt(-8)^2 - 4\times2\times4}{2\times2}\)
⇒ \(x = \frac{8\pm\sqrt32}{4}\)
⇒ \(x = \frac{8\pm4\sqrt2}{4}\)
⇒ \(x = 2\pm\sqrt2\)
⇒ \(x = 2 + \sqrt2\) or \(2 - \sqrt2\)
∴ \(x = 2 - \sqrt2\) (for \(x\) has to be less than its perimeter)
∴ \(y = 2 - 2x = 2 - 2(2 - \sqrt2) = -2 + 2 \sqrt2\)
∴ The length of the longer side = -2 + 2\(\sqrt2\)m
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
A ship sets sail from port A (86\(^o\)N, 56\(^o\)W) for port B (86\(^o\)N, 64\(^o\)W), which is close by. Find the distance the ship covered from port A to port B, correct to the nearest km.

[Take \(\pi\) = 3.142 and R = 6370 km]
explanation:
AB = \(\frac{θ}{360}\times 2\pi Rcos\propto\) (distance on small circle)
= 64 - 56 = 8\(^o\)
\(\propto = 86^o\)
⇒ AB = \(\frac{8}{360}\) x 2 x 3.142 x 6370 x cos 86
⇒ AB = \(\frac{22,338.29974}{360}\)
∴ AB = 62km (to the nearest km)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Use the graph of sin (θ) above to estimate the value of θ when sin (θ) = -0.6 for \(0^o ≤ θ ≤ 360^o\)
explanation:
On the \(y\)-axis, each box is \(\frac{1 - 0}{5} = \frac{1}{5}\) = 0.2unit
On the \(x\)-axis, each box is \(\frac{90 - 0}{6} = \frac{90}{6} = 15^o\)
⇒ \(θ_1 = 180^o + (2.5\times15^o) = 180^o + 37.5^o = 217.5^o ≃ 218^o \)(2 and half boxes were counted to the right of 180\(^o\))
⇒ \(θ_2 = 270^o + (3.5\times15^o) = 270^o + 52.5^o = 322.5^o ≃ 323^o \)(3 and half boxes were counted to the right of 270\(^o\))
∴ \(θ = 218^o, 323^o\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A circle has a radius of 13 cm with a chord 12 cm away from the centre of the circle. Calculate the length of the chord.
explanation:
|AP| = |PB| = \(x\) (The perpendicular to a chord bisects the chord if drawn from the center of the circle.)From ∆OPBUsing Pythagoras theorem⇒ \(13^2 = 12^2 + x^2\)⇒ \(169 = 144 + x^2\)⇒ \(169 - 144 = x^2\)⇒ \(x^2 = 25\)⇒ \(x = \sqrt25 = 5 cm\)∴ Length of the chord |AB| = \(x  + x  = 5 + 5 = 10 cm\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Give the number of significant figures of the population of a town which has approximately 5,020,700 people
explanation:
The two trailing zeros in the number are not significant, but the other five are, making it a five-figure number.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: 200 tickets were sold for a show. VIP tickets costs ₦1,200 and ₦700 for regular. Total amount realised from the sale of the tickets was ₦180,000. Find the number of VIP tickets sold and the the number of regular ticket sold.
explanation:
Let \(x\) = number of VIP tickets sold and\(y\) = number of regular tickets soldTotal number of tickets sold = 200⇒ \(x\) + \(y\) = 200 ---- (i)If it costs ₦1,200 for a VIP ticket, then it costs ₦1200x for \(x\) number of VIP tickets sold andIf it costs ₦700 for a regular ticket, then it costs ₦700\(y\) for \(y\) number of VIP tickets soldThe total amount realised from the sale of tickets = ₦180,000⇒ 1200\(x\) + 700\(y\) = 180000 ----- (ii)From equation (i)\(x\) = 200 - \(y\) ----- (iii)Substitute (200 - \(y\)) for \(x\) in equation (ii)⇒ 1200(200 - \(y\)) + 700\(y\) = 180000⇒ 240000 - 1200\(y\) + 700\(y\) = 180000⇒ 240000 - 500\(y\) = 180000
Collect like terms⇒ 240000 - 180000 = 500\(y\)⇒ 60000 = 500\(y\)
⇒ \(y = \frac{60000}{500} = 120\)
Substitute 120 for \(y\) in equation (iii)⇒ \(x = 200 - 120\)⇒ \(x = 80\)∴ The total number of VIP tickets sold is 80 and regular is 120
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: It takes 12 men 8 hours a day to finish a piece of work in 4 days. In how many days will it take 4 men working 16 hours a day to complete the same piece of work?
explanation:
12 men working 8 hours a day can complete the work in 4 days12 men working1 houra day will complete the same work in (8 x 4) days [working less hours a day means they have to work for more days]1 manworking 1 hour a day will complete same work in (8 x 4 x 12) days [fewer number of men working means the remaining ones will have to work for more days]So, it will take1 manworking1 houra day to complete a piece of work in(8 x 4 x 12) days = 384 daysNow,1 man working16 hoursa day will complete the piece of work in (384/16) days = 24 days [working more hours a day means less days to complete the work]∴4 menworking 16 hours a day will complete the piece of work in (24/4) days = 6 days [more men working means fewer days to complete the work]ALTERNATIVELY
12 x 8 x 4 = 4 x 16 x d
⇒ d = \(\frac{12 \times 8 \times 4}{4 \times 16}\)
⇒ d = \(\frac{384}{64}\)
⇒ d = 6
∴ 4 men working 16 hours a day will complete the piece of work in 6 days
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
